pullRequest.body:
This argument is still needed for almost all the lemmas, which means it can longer be found by unification.

We keep around `expSeries ùïÇ A`, as it's needed for talking about the radius of convergence over different base fields.

This is a prerequisite for #8372, as we can't merge the functions until they have the same interface.

---

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

This is started from the mathport output on https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/pull/19244

nodes.body: I think there's a good chance a few of the instance hypotheses can be removed (in particular, anything that uses IsROrC can probably just use reals), but that's fine to put off.
I'm curious if `ùïÇ` can be stripped from more of the lemmas, using the fact that any normed algebra is a real normed algebra.  But possibly that would interfere with inference in practice?
I think there's a good chance a few of the instance hypotheses can be removed (in particular, anything that uses IsROrC can probably just use reals), but that's fine to put off.

Unfortunately that creates instance diamonds, so is a bad idea. Yes, any concrete `R` should satisfy the former if it satisfies the latter, but that doesn't mean we can safely perform the construction in a theorem *statement*.
Though in this file it turns out that `ùïú` is no longer needed at all, thanks to #9491 landing in the meantime.
Where does `ùïÇ` appear in this theorem?  I only see it in the body, in which case it could naively be `‚Ñö`.
Actually, no, this theorem only holds in characteristic 0.
This lemma transitively uses `norm_natCast`, which I can't apply here.
Why do we need this?  If it's so that we pull in a NormedAlgebra assumption, couldn't we always do that over the reals (since complex normed algebras are real normed algebras)?
Could we switched the normed algebra to be always over the reals, as complex normed algebras are real normed algebras (resp. below)?
Turns out this could be generalized anyway, #10865

pullRequest.title: refactor(Analysis/NormedSpace/Exponential): remove the `ùïÇ` argument from `exp`

source.title: refactor: Remove the K argument from exp

nodes.body: I'm curious if `ùïÇ` can be stripped from more of the lemmas, using the fact that any normed algebra is a real normed algebra.  But possibly that would interfere with inference in practice?
